Author: djworth
Content: I'm in the early stages of starting my startup and I'm interested to hear how others are obtaining health insurance.

Author: djworth
Title: What are you doing about health insurance?

Author: plinkplonk
Content: Thank You. We plan to use both automated unit and web interface tests.

Author: plinkplonk
Content:
"Is it also what you wanted to hear ?"

If I "want to hear something" I will let you know in advance thank you :-) .

While it is impossible to convey all the nuances of the choice before me in a paragraph, I believe the question was very specific. - Have any of the y combinator companies used XP (and want to talk about it)? Not "Is XP a good thing? What do you think?" or "Can you confirm what I want to hear"? ;-)

I hope I don't sound rude , but if you are part of a y combinator funded startup and are using XP, I'd like your permission to mail you off thread with more questions about how you are implementing some of the practices in the context of a startup, but I am not looking for "generic" opinions about XP. I can use the internet for that.

I am sorry if the question wasn't clear enough. Thanks for your comments anyway.

Author: far33d
Content: Wouldn't taking half of that 50% still be a significant amount of Google's pie? Killing doesn't require taking all of the pie - it just requires taking enough. \n
